title: Fixed width font list for Word
content: Ok, it is pathetic and you should hang me (preferably before I hang myself). It looks like due to tech restrictions I must use a fixed width font for a project that, preferably, is commonly used by Microsoft Word (for the ease of our illustrious customers, doncha know). I can't seem to find a list of fixed width fonts that are found by default in Word. Could someone at least point me to a place where I could find such info? Googling and searching Microsoft's site didn't seem to help.
author: wambafool

comments.content:
hi,

just check sites like  
 [http://www.kayskreations.net/fonts/fonttb.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002022241/http:/www.kayskreations.net/fonts/fonttb.html "http://www.kayskreations.net/fonts/fonttb.html")  
or even MS's own typo site at  
 [http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/default.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002022241/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/default.aspx "http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/default.aspx")  
to get lists of standard fonts installed with specific applications.  
I guess you will be able to figure out which of these are fixed width  
ones?

If you are looking for a good fixed width / programming font, just  
check [www.lowing.org/fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002022241/http:/www.lowing.org/fonts "www.lowing.org/fonts") or keithdevens.com/wiki/ProgrammerFonts

Jean
Thanks Jean, I'll check those out!
